physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Weakness of ankle dorsiflexion (MRC grade 3/5), weakness of great toe extension (MRC grade 3/5), decreased sensation to pinprick on the dorsum of the right foot. The patient reported vague discomfort in the lateral part of the right lower leg.

Motor nerve conduction study indicated a reduction of compound muscle action potential (CMAP) amplitude stimulating at the fibular neck; distal CMAP amplitude was lower compared to the left side. Sensory nerve action potential (SNAP) amplitude of the right superficial fibular nerve was decreased (2 mV, reference value > 7 mV). Needle EMG showed spontaneous activity in the right tibialis anterior and right extensor digitorum brevis.

MRI revealed a lobulated cystic mass (approximately 2.5 cm) between the proximal tibia and fibular neck, along the anatomical course of the deep and superficial fibular nerves. The mass showed low to intermediate signal intensity on T1-weighted images and high signal intensity on T2-weighted images.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: The clinical picture remained unchanged at follow-up.

physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Postoperatively, the patient displayed significant improvement with only minor weakness of foot dorsiflexion remaining.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: Condition remains stable without recurrence of symptoms after 1 year.
